properties.Name: TermsOfEmployment

Columns.Name: ContractId
Columns.Description: The unique identifier of a Contract.

Columns.Name: AgreementEffectiveDate
Columns.Description: The effective date of the agreement.

Columns.Name: EmploymentAtWillSection
Columns.Description: This section establishes that either the employer or employee may terminate the employment at any time for any legal reason.

Columns.Name: ConfidentialInformationSection
Columns.Description:
This section establishes that the employee must consent to properly deal with employer sensitive information:

-

Columns.Name: InventionsSection
Columns.Description: This section establishes the conditions by which the employer assumes property rights to inventions developed by the employee in conjunction with their normal work.

Columns.Name: ConflictingEmploymentSection
Columns.Description: This section addresses work performed by the employee that conflicts with the employee's job responsibilities to the employer.

Columns.Name: ReturnOfCompanyDocumentsSection
Columns.Description: This section establishes rules regarding the return of all company documentation by the employee at the end of their employment.

Columns.Name: NotificationOfNewEmployerSection
Columns.Description: This section establishes that upon leaving the company the employer is permitted to discuss with the employee's new employer the obligations of the employee according to this document.

Columns.Name: SolicitationOfEmployeesSection
Columns.Description: This section specifies the period of time following the termination of employment, that the employee will not attempt to hire away former coworkers.

Columns.Name: OtherPoliciesSection
Columns.Description: This section states that the employee will comply with all company regulations.

Columns.Name: EquitableReliefSection
Columns.Description: This section addresses the granting of equitable relief to the employer in the case where the employee fails to comply with the terms of employment.

Columns.Name: GeneralProvisionsSection
Columns.Description:
This section typically addresses four subsections regarding administrative issues:

(1)  The company establishes the state of governing law of the document.

(2)  The section makes clear the terms of employment document is the entire agreement between
both parties

(3)   In case one or more sections are deemed unenforceable by a court, the rest of the provisions remain in effect

(4)  The Terms of Employment are binding upon both the employer and employee

Properties.Description: The terms of employment signed by new employees in acknowledgement that they understand the basic conditions of their employment.
